body.name: Anolon Advanced Home Hard Anodized Nonstick Frying Pan/Skillet with Helper Handle, 14.5 Inch - Bronze
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 5 hrs 2 mins
FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 5 hrs 2 mins
features: OPTIMAL NONSTICK PERFORMANCE: The Anolon Advanced Home nonstick frying pan features ultra-durable nonstick release so your creations glide out of the pan easily for years to come.
EVEN HEATING THAT LASTS: Large skillet is engineered for fast, perfectly uniform heating. Hard-anodized construction is twice as hard as stainless steel for maximum durability.
COMFORT & CONTROL: Enjoy every stir, turn, and pour with a durable SureGrip pan handle for a secure and comfortable hold
EASY TO CLEAN FINISH: Anolon Advanced Home features stain-resistant nonstick exteriors to keep this pan looking newer, longer
STOVE TO OVEN: Oven safe to 400°F so you can finish off every dish to perfection
body.description: Sublime cooking starts here. Anolon Advanced Home provides aspiring chefs with one of the very best nonsticks available, so step up to a crafted kitchen essential designed to outperform, outlast, and outshine your current cookware. Engineered for fast, uniform heating, this large hard-anodized frying pan with helper handle is twice as hard as stainless steel for durability that lasts. Made for big batch recipes and family sized meals, this large frying pan features a convenient helper handle to move between kitchen stations. Oven safe to 400°F, the nonstick skillet features Infinity Slide technology for one of the longest lasting and smoothest-gliding cookware surfaces you can buy. If you expect more from your nonstick, welcome to the sublime cooking experience of Anolon Advanced Home.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Anolon Advanced Home Collection Featuring Our Enhanced Nonstick What's the biggest difference between our original Anolon Advanced and Anolon Advanced Home collections? We already had a premium quality nonstick on our original Anolon Advanced cookware. Now, Anolon Advanced Home features our enhanced Infinity Slide nonstick, which lasts 16 times longer than traditional nonstick and 80 times longer than ceramic cookware!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Real good pans
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been using these pans for several months now. They are the best non stick pans I have ever used and I am surprised because they are so reasonably priced! These have performed better than expensive pans I have purchased. These pans DO NOT STICK and clean up really easy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super nice pan!
reviews.reviewText: Not much to say, except that it’s very easy to clean, the nonstick works flawlessly, it heats, very evenly and fast, has a heavy quality feel in a really solid insulated handle. It’s a little more expensive than others, but I have always found this brand to be of superior quality, and this pan is no exception. I don’t regret my purchase at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Actual Quality Pan
reviews.reviewText: The copper color is very sophisticated. The 3.5” depth is so much more practical that my last pan. More importantly, this pan actually delivers on its promises of quality, unlike pretty much every single pan under $100 out there. It is truly nonstick, without the toxic materials. It’s heavy, but you don’t need a crane to lift it like cast iron. And it truly sits flat and steady on my glass stovetop. It doesn’t wobble around, and oil sits in the dead center without rolling to the sides. It heats and cooks very evenly, as well. If you’re between this pan and one of those $40-50 14” pan options on Amazon, don’t hesitate and spend the extra $10-20 for this pan. You won’t regret it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Unfortunately I returned mine
reviews.reviewText: I've used Analon for years. I have purchased onesies and as a set. I found that onesies like this one are better quality than the ones that come as part of a set. What I mean is that the sides are taller, the pan is thicker, and the coating appears to be better. The coating on my set has worn off of two pans. Thankfully Analon made it good via the lifetime warranty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Eggs slide off pan easily
reviews.reviewText: I really like how easily eggs slide off the pan and it is easy to clean. I also have no complaints with its balance or handle. It seems well constructed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars After two months of use, this is a 5+ star pan!!!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this 2 months ago. Have used it several dozen times.Will it wear out in a few years? Maybe. If so, I'll buy another without complaints. If they only rented this pan for $10/year, I'd sign a lifelong agreement, it's that good.This is an awesome pan, and no matter what else you own, spring for $20 and change and get one of these. Great price for gifting, too, which I'm considering right now.This is my go-to pan now, and I only pick another if I need bigger or want cast iron. Otherwise, this is it. You can NOT go wrong. Silicone handle means it doesn't get hot and can go in the oven up to 400°. The metal tip at the end does not get hot on the stove, although the metal part of the handle right next to the pan does. So you do have to be a little careful.The only thing that would make me up my rating to 5.5 stars is if the silicone handle extended another 1/2" or so closer to the pan, but then it would be exposed to gas flames and might melt, or whatever silicone does when it's overheated. But the silicone part is big enough for my hand; just be normally cautious and you'll be fine. I wasn't once and I didn't burn myself much, just an annoyance that taught me to be a little more careful.Eggs for one or two people are what this pan is perfect for.It is the only pan I've ever owned that I considered more than just a utilitarian pan. This is a work of art. The color, the weight, the balance, the handle, the temperature tolerance. I guess that's both art and engineering. Even if you don't need the pan, buy one and use it as a coffee table conversation piece.One last practical comment. If you own an infrared thermometer, I encourage you to use it the first few times you use the pan to see how hot you're getting it based on your burner settings. Then you shouldn't have to worry about it. The pan is so small that it will heat up fast and hot, and you could go over the 500° limit if you went to high heat and weren't cooking much in it. No reason at all to destroy this pan if you use a little common sense. The 400° limit for traditional Teflon was one I never seemed to be able to stay within, and I cooked many a Teflon pan in the past. This Dupont Autograph 2 coating is wonderful and should last years if you don't abuse it.Oh, and if you don't own an infrared thermometer, why not? Amazon has them as cheap as a dozen bucks. I can't attest to how good one would be that's that cheap, but do your research. I bought a Maverick on here a couple years ago for $38 and it's been one of the best purchases I've ever made. It's extremely accurate; I have a Thermapen and have tested both with ice water and boiling water and the Maverick is within 1° accuracy (Thermapen is obviously the gold standard here and it was right on as well). It'll pay for itself by helping you avoid ruining food and pans in the kitchen, and will let you run around the house checking temperatures of walls, furniture, whatever. You'll be able to better balance your heating system by adjusting vents. You'll be able to test sleeping people to be sure they're still alive. And the laser beam is great entertainment for pets. So many uses!!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The first thing that impressed me with this pan was its weight. Of course, it's light compared with cast iron but heavier than most non-stick pans I've had. The fact that it's 8.5 inches makes a difference when flipping bread for French toast. I used it to cook a cold sear steak. I'd seen a video on youtube using a non-stick pan for that method and it worked very well. I hate to think how difficult cleaning was with cast iron because with this pan it's so easy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality is remembered
reviews.reviewText: My old 10 and 12 inch non stick fry pans finally died from overuse, and I was forced to replace them. Little did I know how many choices and price points were out there. They ranged from dirt cheap to ridiculous. I eventually came upon my new favorites made by Anolon.I have nothing but praise for this company. The pans are a joy to use in part because of the handle design which give the pans a nice balance and a more secure feel. This is especially important if you’re in a busy kitchen or at home. The construction is first rate; heavy aluminum with a nice nonstick surface. No short cuts here in quality.And the best part is the price: I got both pans for what the fancier brands were charging for only one.
Only used it a few times but this is the best nonstick frying pan I have ever owned. Heats quickly and evenly, everything slides our easily, even fried eggs. Very easy to clean
Está marca es un poco costosa pero a comparación de otras es de excelente calidad
Muy resistente y de buena calidad, lo volvería a comprar
The media could not be loaded. A must in every kitchen !It’s large and deep and most importantly, it doesn’t stick !Wow !

reviews.reviewTitle: Great pan but don’t be fooled by the lifetime warranty.
reviews.reviewText: Will not last a lifetime but great pan……keep away from high heat (use between low to medium heat) and it may last 3-4 yrs before having to replace it pending how it’s washed.
